repo.name: neovim

comment_data.body: `set_var_const()` does more things, like notify watchers, prevent the copy when vimvar of wrong type etc. I'd put this is an if statement replacing all of 399-422 (new line numbers) when `vimvar` is set. (using `tv_clear()` and early return would be fine)
Just noticed that the vvar stuff in `set_var_const` has an early return that always skips the dictwatcher notify logic. Maybe a bug? :thinking:

You'll need the whole block to prevent changing their types also.

Glancing at this PR, I think the `scope` logic could have been replaced by `dict == &vimvardict` too, but maybe a better idea would be to factor out the common `v:` handling logic from `set_var_const` instead.
(Also `nvim_set_vvar` would have to be addressed somehow too; it has the same issue, but a different codepath).

While it works, it duplicates the logic (and misses the call to `redraw_all_later`) and doesn't address being able to change the type (e.g: `vim.v.errors = 3` should not be allowed).

I think ideally it'd be best to factor the `v:` validation logic in `set_var_const` (without calling `set_var_const` itself).
hmmm maybe. that's a test I removed `redraw_all_later` .
Oh, seems zeer's handling this now at #25325
already saw that  so delete branch, If want to solve it, please do it as soon as possible. rather than after others have spent time on it.

title: fix(lua): vim var not take effect from luascript
